clinical_study.brief_title: Using RCT to Increase Completion Rates of the Health Assessment Questionnaire.
clinical_study.official_title: Using Rapid Cycle Randomized Controlled Trials to Increase Completion Rates of the Patient-Reported Health Assessment Questionnaire During Outpatient Visits at NYU Langone Orthopedic Center

lead_sponsor.agency: New York University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: New York University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The proposed study aims to examine several iterations of instructions/reminders that patients receive for completing the Health Assessment Questionnaire (self-reported health outcomes) for their outpatient visit at NYU Langone Orthopedic Center. The goal is to increase the completion rates of patient-reported health outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: Questionnaire Completion Rate (number of times patients complete or partially complete the questionnaire).
primary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of the study, up to 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: Completion rate data is routinely collected by the medical center.

arm_group.description: Participants in this group will receive the current version of instructions (a verbal reminder) for completing the Health Assessment Questionnaire.
Participants in this group will be exposed to additional instructions that remind them to complete the Health Assessment Questionnaire.

intervention.description: Participants will receive a verbal reminder to complete the Health Assessment Questionnaire from the intake personnel, as part of usual care.

Intervention includes various iterations of instructions for completing the Health Assessment Questionnaire. Participants will receive these instructions in addition to the verbal reminder from the intake personnel (usual care).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients who are eligible to receive the Health Assessment Questionnaire in preparation for and during their outpatient visit to the NYU Langone Orthopedic Center.
